fix: enable mock API for production/static deployments

The shouldUseMockAPI() function was not checking DISABLE_NETWORK_CALLS,
causing auth flows to fail in production because:
- DISABLE_NETWORK_CALLS is true in production builds
- But shouldUseMockAPI() returned false (no USE_MOCK_API flag)
- Real API calls were attempted but blocked/failed

Now shouldUseMockAPI() returns true when DISABLE_NETWORK_CALLS is set,
ensuring the mock authentication works in static deployments.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

feat: integrate RuVector self-learning vector store

Implements 4-phase RuVector integration:
- Phase 1: Vector store replacement with factory pattern and A/B testing
- Phase 2: Knowledge graph unification with Cypher query support
- Phase 3: Learning integration with feedback bridge and metrics
- Phase 4: Semantic agent routing with embedding-based selection

New components:
- VectorStoreProtocol, LearningVectorStoreProtocol, GraphVectorStoreProtocol
- RuVectorStore with GNN, adaptive compression, hybrid search
- VectorStoreFactory with DualWriteVectorStore for safe migration
- GraphQueryAdapter and CypherQueryBuilder for graph operations
- VectorFeedbackBridge and LearningMetrics for quality tracking
- SemanticAgentRouter for intelligent agent selection

All 279 unit tests pass, validation script confirms 9/9 checks.

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

feat: add Railway deployment configuration

Add Railway.app cloud deployment configuration for production hosting.

**Configuration Files:**
- railway.json: Build and deploy settings (Dockerfile-based)
- railway.toml: Service configuration with health checks
- Procfile: Start command for Railway
- docs/RAILWAY_DEPLOYMENT.md: Complete deployment guide

**Railway Project:**
- Project ID: d68407f9-0f65-4cbf-9d4c-f3008342d848
- Project URL: https://railway.com/project/d68407f9-0f65-4cbf-9d4c-f3008342d848
- Environment: production

**Services to Deploy:**
1. API Service (Node.js) - Dockerfile.api
2. PostgreSQL Database (Railway managed)
3. Redis Cache (Railway managed)
4. ML Service (Python) - Dockerfile.ml (optional)

**Next Steps:**
- Add PostgreSQL and Redis plugins via Railway dashboard
- Configure environment variables (JWT_SECRET, etc.)
- Deploy with: railway up
- Access at: https://<project-name>.up.railway.app

feat: Add deployment guide and success modal for user guidance (#3)

FEATURES ADDED:

1. generateDeploymentGuide() Method:
   - Creates DEPLOYMENT.md in output directory
   - Step-by-step deployment instructions
   - Platform-specific guides (GitHub Pages, Netlify, Vercel)
   - Troubleshooting section
   - Site structure documentation

2. Success Modal (Auto-shows on first visit):
   - Beautiful animated modal
   - Clear 3-step process (Preview  Review  Deploy)
   - Interactive deployment options
   - Platform-specific quick guides
   - Dismissible and remembers state (localStorage)

USER EXPERIENCE:
- After generation: DEPLOYMENT.md created automatically
- On first site visit: Modal shows next steps
- Click deployment platform: See quick instructions
- Modal auto-hides after first visit
- Can reopen by clicking 'Ver Gu穩a Completa'

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Added method to DeploymentService
- Embedded modal in TemplateEngine HTML
- Styled with gradient animations
- Responsive design
- Accessibility features (close button, keyboard support)

Resolves missing user guidance after site generation.

fix: Enhance SSE progress tracking and jobs error display

- SSE stream now tracks stage-level progress (not just overall_progress)
- Trigger SSE updates on stage change or stage_progress change
- Faster polling (0.3s vs 0.5s) for more responsive updates
- Jobs API includes error_details with failed_stage info and summary
- Add logging to output_stage for better debugging
- Fix test assertions for conditional thumbnail inclusion

Root causes:
- SSE only tracked discrete overall_progress jumps between stages
- Jobs page didn't expose per-stage error details

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
